clinical_study.brief_title: Choice Architecture and Mailed Colorectal Cancer Screening Outreach in a Community Health Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Choice Architecture and Mailed Colorectal Cancer Screening Outreach in a Community Health Setting

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 3-arm randomized trial aimed at increasing rates of participation in colorectal cancer (CRC) screening by outreach to patients' homes using choice architecture informed by behavioral science principles.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will evaluate the effectiveness of mailed outreach with choice between colonoscopy and FIT, and FIT alone, as compared to colonoscopy alone in increasing CRC screening rates.

primary_outcome.description: Screening completion rate in arm 2 (Choice) to arm 1 (Colonoscopy only) and arm 3 (FIT only) separately.

secondary_outcome.measure: Choice of Colorectal Cancer Screening Test
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients choosing either FIT or Colonoscopy in study arm 2 (Choice)

arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will receive a letter from their provider informing them they are overdue for colon cancer screening and requesting their participation in colonoscopy, and including a referral for the procedure at a local endoscopy center. Participants will be provided a phone number if interested in navigated colonoscopy scheduling.

Participants in this arm will receive a letter from their provider informing them they are overdue for colon cancer screening and requesting their participation in their choice of either colonoscopy or mailed fecal immunochemical testing (FIT). The letter will include both a referral for the colonoscopy at a local endoscopy enter and a FIT kit with a lab requisition and instructions for completion.

Participants in this arm will receive a letter from their provider informing them they are overdue for colon cancer screening and requesting their participation in FIT testing. The letter will include a FIT kit with lab requisition and instructions for completion.

intervention.description: Mailed letter asking participants to complete CRC screening by colonoscopy
Mailed letter and FIT test asking participants to complete CRC screening by their choice of either colonoscopy or mailed FIT
Mailed letter and FIT test asking participants to complete CRC screening by mailed FIT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. At least 1 visit with CHDC in the past 2 years
2. Not up to date on CRC screening (no evidence of colonoscopy in the last 10 years, sigmoidoscopy in the last 5 years, or stool testing in the past 12 months)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of CRC or polyps
2. Significant family history of CRC
3. History of Inflammatory Bowel Disease or Ulcerative Colitis
4. History of colectomy
5. History of metastatic cancer
6. Current use of Medication Assisted Therapy (MAT)
